title: BBC Local Live: Essex on Tuesday, 15 December 2015 - BBC News
summary: essex police rated as 'inadequate ' for the way it deals with vulnerable people .
parents of hockey player who died after a training ground accident encourage people to sign up as organ donors .
an mp calls on the government to focus on improving access to stansted rather than build a third runway at heathrow .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for essex have finished for today .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
have a great evening .

documents.title: weather tonight : showery rain expected
text: the rain will clear by midnight and then it will be dry briefly before further showery rain sweeps through on a brisk southwesterly wind .
minimum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: c2c to review timetable changes
text: the south essex rail operator c2c says it will review major changes to its timetable after hundreds of passengers criticised the alterations .
many commuters say there are fewer seats and longer journey times .

chris atkinson , communications manager for the firm , said : `` we 're trying to get the right balance we 've made changes since the consultation , we 're going to continue to watch it very closely .
to work out how could we make it better .
if we can , then let 's do it . ''

documents.title: manufacturing firm in maldon fined after worker crushes hand
text: a manufacturing company has been fined £ 20,000 after a man suffered crush injuries to his hand from the moving rollers in a machine .
in may last year , a worker at fiberweb geosynthetics in maldon was unblocking some plastic film that was jamming the production run when his hand got trapped .
an investigation by the health and safety executive found that there was no safe system in place for clearing product jams .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: expert thinks missing 'pineapple ' has been melted down
text: historic england is calling on people to help track down missing works of public art , including basildon 's missing `` pineapple '' statue .
vin harrop , the organiser of basildon 's heritage trail , said he believed it had been stolen and melted down .
`` it 's called the pineapple because people loved it basildon people christened it as that and have taken it to their hearts .
it 's a favourite - they really like it , '' he said .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: woman charged with gbh after stabbing
text: a 27-year-old woman has been charged with causing grievous bodily harm after a man was stabbed in a block of flats in southend .
she was arrested early yesterday morning after the incident in st mary 's court flats in victoria avenue .
a man aged in his 40s went to hospital with injuries that were not life-threatening , police say .
author: Nick Alliker
BBC Essex

documents.title: headlines : essex police 'making improvements ' woman charged after stabbing
text: headlines : essex police 'making improvements ' woman charged after stabbing
author: Nick Alliker
BBC Essex

documents.title: police chief says child exploitation awareness must improve
text: the chief constable of essex police has been explaining why he thinks the force was one of four found to be inadequate at dealing with vulnerable victims .
he says attitudes towards children who may go missing frequently are among those that need to change .
the old-fashioned expression is that they come back 'safe and well ' .
well , guess what ?
they come back abused , with drugs and alcohol in their system and that 's just not good enough . ''

documents.title: fly-tippers dump boat in harlow
text: a police officer has tweeted a of fly-tipping in harlow from his body camera , which appears to include an abandoned boat .
pc josh haase says that harlow council is aware of the situation , and he is meeting with them this afternoon to discuss it .
a from my body-camera of the fly tipping in the flex meadow area of # harlow - @ twitterid are aware

author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live

documents.title: full interview with hockey player 's family
text: the family of tom wilson , who died last week after being hit with a hockey stick in a training ground accident , have been speaking of their pride in him on bbc essex .
you can listen to the full interview by clicking here .
author: BBC Essex

documents.title: weather : rain on the way
text: it 's quite cloudy in essex this lunchtime and there is some drizzle in parts .
more rain is coming in this afternoon .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: colchester united hoping for new manager before boxing day
text: colchester united chairman , robbie cowling , says it 's 'unlikely ' the club will have a new manager in place before this weekend 's league one match at rochdale .
the u 's owner told a season ticket holder 's forum he 'd ideally like to appoint someone before the boxing day derby against southend united .
caretaker manager wayne brown remains in the frame to be handed the job permanently .
author: Glenn Speller
BBC Essex Sport

documents.title: cliffs along coastline in clacton to be stabilised
text: more than £ 5m is to be spent on a project to stabilise cliffs along the coastline at clacton and holland-on-sea .
nearly half of the money has been found after work to protect the coastline , where rock groynes were built and 23 new beaches were created , came in under budget .
tendring district council said the cliffs required regrading in places , and drainage needed to be replaced .

documents.title: pineapple statue last seen three years ago
text: missing basildon art work the pineapple was last seen in 2011 when its new owner moved it into storage ahead of plans to turn the building it sat outside into housing .
historic england has created this poster as part of its campaign to track down the missing art .
the artist estimated it would cost around £ 500,000 to recreate the work today .
author: Richard Haugh
BBC News

documents.title: have you seen the lost 'pineapple ' ?
text: historic england - formerly english heritage - is calling on people to help track down missing works of public art .
it revealed that a growing number of post-war works have been destroyed , sold , lost or stolen from public places including schools and parks .
one such piece is the pineapple , created by william mitchell in 1977 , which used to reside in basildon .
author: Richard Haugh
BBC News

documents.title: former nurse 's victims 'showed great courage '
text: former psychiatric nurse christopher bosworth denied sexually assaulting four men but was found guilty following a three-week trial at basildon crown court .

det supt danny walker : said : `` i would like to pay tribute to the four male victims who showed great courage in coming forward and giving evidence against the defendant who had taken advantage of his position in order to sexually abuse them when they were vulnerable .
`` the sentence received accurately reflects the seriousness of the offences and the impact it has had on the victims . ''
author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live

documents.title: former nurse jailed for historical sexual abuse
text: a former psychiatric nurse has been jailed for 14 years and six months for sexual offences .

christopher bosworth , 57 , was arrested at his home in wales by detectives from essex police following sexual assault allegations dating back to the 1980s.his victims were from the wickford area of essex and the willesden and kingsbury areas of london .
author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : essex police disappointed at 'inadequate ' rating hockey player 's parents proud of son 's organ donation
text: headlines : essex police disappointed at 'inadequate ' rating hockey player 's parents proud of son 's organ donation
author: Laura Safe
BBC Essex

documents.title: braintree prepare to face bromley
text: braintree town manager danny cowley says bromley will pose them plenty of threats in the fa trophy tonight .
the sides meet in the first round at cressing road .
the irons will be at home again in round two if they can see off their opponents , with stourbridge awaiting the winner in round two .
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex sport

documents.title: 'focus on stansted ' , mp asks
text: an mp has asked the government to abandon `` environmentally unsustainable '' plans for a third runway at heathrow airport , and to focus on stansted instead .
liberal democrat foreign affairs spokesman tom brake says that ministers should focus on improving surface access to stansted to allow more flights .
ministers have put off a decision about the runway off until next summer to allow more discussions on the environmental impact .
author: Laura Safe
BBC Essex

documents.title: hockey player signed up to organ register 'in freshers ' week '
text: lisa wilson , whose son tom died in a hockey ground training accident last week , said he signed up to the organ donation register during freshers ' week at nottingham trent university .

she told bbc essex that she had been wondering whether to donate his organs , when the nurses said they had found tom 's name on the database , and that the family took great comfort from the fact that he had helped 20 people .
`` two of his teammates gave tom cpr on the pitch ; they started his heart and got it working .
it was beating until the last minute if they had n't done that we would not have been able to donate his heart , '' she said .
author: Richard Smith
BBC Essex

documents.title: hockey player 's parents 'so proud ' of son
text: tom wilson , 22 , who died a week ago in a hockey accident , has helped 20 people by donating his organs , his parents told bbc essex .
his mother lisa said : `` he really was the perfect son ; he was in the prime of his life .
he was just so unlucky ; he was in the wrong place at the wrong time .

`` a small part of his liver has gone to a child and his bones can be used to help someone who had a sporting injury even after his death we are so proud to find out that tom had made that decision to be an organ donor . ''
author: Richard Smith
BBC Essex

documents.title: hockey player 's family campaign for organ donations
text: the parents of a hockey player , who died after an accident at an essex training ground , are encouraging people to sign up to be organ donors .
tom wilson , 22 , received a blow to the head at old loughtonians hockey club in chigwell a week ago .
graham and lisa wilson , from hornchurch , say their son will help many people as a result of his decision to be a donor .
author: Richard Smith
BBC Essex

documents.title: force 'is improving ' says chief
text: a report into the way essex police deals with vulnerable victims found that factors such as a disability , age or having been subjected to repeated offences often unfairly count against them .
chief constable stephen kavanagh has told bbc essex that action is already under way to make improvements , particularly when it comes to domestic violence .
he says he thinks the reason the force has come out as inadequate is due to the way it treats missing children , which needs to improve .

documents.title: essex police 'disappointed ' about report
text: the chief constable of essex police , steve kavanagh , says it 's `` really disappointing '' that the force wasone of only four in the country to be rated as inadequate at dealing with vulnerable victims .
her majesty 's inspectorate of constabulary says the force has `` significant weaknesses '' when it responds to domestic violence , missing people or children at risk of being sexually abused .
inspectors found it ranked as one of the worst forces in the country at supporting those at risk , along with bedfordshire , staffordshire and surrey .

documents.title: weather : cloudy and misty start
text: it 's a cloudy and misty start with drizzle in places , but it will become drier and brighter as the morning goes on .
more rain is on its way this afternoon though , becoming more persistent and occasionally heavy this evening .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: travel : problems on the a12
text: there are severe delays on the a12 northbound near chelmsford , from j12 to j14 , because of an accident involving two vehicles .
the police are also tweeting about problems at j15 , at three mile hill .
# a12 we are now dealing with a lorry that has lost its prop shaft and struck two cars ahead of our rolling block .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: headlines : police rated 'inadequate ' hockey player 's parents encourage organ donation
text: headlines : police rated 'inadequate ' hockey player 's parents encourage organ donation
author: Laura Safe
BBC Essex

documents.title: welcome to tuesday 's essex live page
text: hello and welcome to a new day here on the local live page for essex .
we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for our county up until 18:00 this evening .
if you 'd like to say hello , drop us an email , tweet us , or visit our facebook page .
author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live
